diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Dermatomyositis associated with the antisynthetase syndrome (most likely with anti–PL-12 or anti–PL-7 autoantibodies)
differential_diagnosis: Infection (including HIV, bartonella, toxoplasmosis, infectious mononucleosis, histoplasmosis, parvovirus, syphilis)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient's constellation of symptoms included fever, arthritis, rash, pulmonary lesions, lymphadenopathy, and a family history of autoimmune disease, suggesting a collagen vascular disease. Imaging studies showed interstitial lung disease, and lab tests were consistent with dermatomyositis. Pathological examination indicated a mixed pattern of lung disease suggestive of associated connective-tissue disease. Positive testing for anti–PL-12 antibodies confirmed the diagnosis of the antisynthetase syndrome associated with dermatomyositis.
